author: Gus_263
title: King of the  visorak hordes
review: This is also a great set, have some black pieces and it makes awesome color schemes. He also have a spinner launcher, like the 2005 sets. In the launcher, in his hand, have two hooks two, that makes a claw. The head is different, don't have a mask. In another arm, he have a blade that can moves for front, and back in the normal position.

author: Pepper
title: tall
review:
I got this for my birthday in 2005 along with a Visorak Vohtarak and a Vakama Hordika mask. As far as I remember, he is my tallest titan.

pros
herding blade
rhotuka spinner
strong apperance
normal pieces look believeable as armor
cool looking head
nice feet
claws hold rhotuka spinner pretty well

cons
some of his joints squeak when you move him around
stiff

Overall, one of the best titans. If you have Roodaka or Keetongu you should have Sidorak.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Warriors) - Sidorak Review
review:
This is a great set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 76 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has some nice and useful pieces: We get a lot of dark red and black pieces which are always great to have for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't get any stickers to worry about.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8756-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. One hand has a dagger which can be folded. The other hand has a claw and a spinner which you can shoot very well, too. The only thing which I don't like about this figure is that it is falling down very easily.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: reidak12
title: King of the Visorak
review:
I built this set from the giant Voporak set. Sidorak is one of my favorite large sets, although he does have a few weak points.

Pros
very tall
good red and black color scheme
adequate build
flip out herding blade is very interesting
claws on left arm look great
rhotuka spinner doesn't fall off
face is creepy

Cons
not as sturdy as Keetongu
the arms

I'd like to take a moment to describe the arms. Each arm is attached at the shoulder to a large technic wheel, which allows the arm to spin around vertically. This severely limits posability. Also, on mine, the left gear squeaks terribly, though I'm not sure if this is standard or not. The right arm simply ends in a blade, so it is nearly impossible to pose. The left arm does have a joint in it, but simply ends in the claws.

Despite the terrible arms, I still give Sidorak a four out of five. If you can find one for a good price, he's totally worth getting, if only for the flip out blade.

author: tkettle9719
title: Aragog: The Meaner Bionicle Edition
review:
I got this set for Christmas many years ago, and think that this goes great with Keetongu and all of the 2005 sets.

Pros

  • -The weapons displayed here are amazing.
  • -This set shows that size and role is essential to Bionicle.
  • …

Cons

  • -The legs seem just a bit thin.
  • -The mask thing looks just a bit weird and out-of-place.
  • …

This set is an excellent accompanist to the rest of the series for 2005, and is very individual. I highly recommend this set.

author: Nmfrey23
title: All hail the king
review:
This guy is supposed to be the King of the Visorak-the spider-like creatures released in 2005. Despite his title as King, Sidorak is anything but intrepid and confident. Either way, the set itself is definitely representative of a ruler. The Titans of 2005 were arguably the best part of Bionicle in the year, and Sidorak fits right in with the other two released alongside him.

Pros: 

This set is more complex than most, since the feet, legs, torso, arms and head are custom builds.

Posing: This set features more movement than others that were released before it.

Torso build: The torso is armoured very well, and makes the set look more complete with its wide shoulder pads.

Functions: This set has 2 functions. Sidorak's left arm is cut off at the elbow and has a switchblade-like weapon attached to it that can flick out and retract. His second function is his spinner which he holds in his hand. His hand has a much-needed thumb and two forefingers to keep the spinner still.

His right arm is connected via. friction pin, so he can aim his spinner (also makes a cool clicking sound when moved).

Cons:

Poor balance due to the set's height and thin limbs 

The left arm has no friction and hangs loosely at Sidorak's side

His arms have 2 different shoulders, The top shoulder allows for the arms to move forward and back and the second shoulder allows for the arms to move outward and inward

Back of the set is flat and unfinished looking

At the end of the day, while Sidorak wasn't a great king, he did make for a great set that managed to combine form and function well. 4/5
